 [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עָרַג‎</span>] **verb** ==long for== (compare Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***ascend***, II. ***bend, incline*** toward (<img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">); <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***high, elevated***; Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***ascend***; Late Hebrew <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֲרוּגָה‎</span> = Biblical Hebrew); — 

**Qal** ***Imperfect*** 3 feminine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תַּעֲרֹג‎</span> [[Ps.42.2|Ps 42:2]] (of stag, with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַל‎</span> of thing in simile); with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶל‎</span>, of longing for God v[[Ps.42.2|Ps 42:2]] (subject <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נַפְשִׁי‎</span>), so <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תַּעֲרוֺג‎</span> [[Joel.1.20|Joel 1:20]] (of beasts, craving water). 



 I. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֲרָד‎</span> **proper name, of a location** ==Canaanite city in the Negeb==, <span class="bdbLangGreek">Αραδ</span> (Egyptian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***±a-ru-dâ***</u></abbr> [[BDB#WMM|WMM]]<sup> As.u.Eur.168,170</sup>); — [[Judg.1.16|Judg 1:16]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מֶלֶחעֿ‎</span> [[Num.21.1|Num 21:1]] ([[BDB#J|J]][[BDB#E|E]]) = [[Num.33.40|Num 33:40]], [[Josh.12.14|Josh 12:14]] ([[BDB#D|D]], <span class="bdbLangGreek">Α</span>(<span class="bdbLangGreek">ι</span>)<span class="bdbLangGreek">ραθ</span>, [[BDB#A|A]] [[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]]<sup>L</sup></lookup> <span class="bdbLangGreek">Αδερ</span>); probably modern ***Tel Arad***, 16 1/2 miles south of Hebron; compare [[BDB#GFM|GFM]]<sup> [[Judg.1.16|Judg 1:16]]</sup> [[BDB#Buhl|Buhl]]<sup> Geogr. 182</sup>. 

 II. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֲרָד‎</span> **proper name, masculine** ==Benjamite== [[1Chr.8.15|1Chr 8:15]], <span class="bdbLangGreek">Ωρηρ</span>, [[BDB#A|A]] <span class="bdbLangGreek">Αρωδ</span>, [[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]]<sup>L</sup></lookup> <span class="bdbLangGreek">Αραδ</span>.
